subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] CW Program for morse code
author: Stefan Bion
full_text:
Hi,

here's a screenshot of the CwGet program while decoding the morse code
produced by EVPmaker + morse.wav:

http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/Stefan/Morse%20code/cwget_screenshot.png

The only "meaningful" message I could get in a 1 minute session was
"I am".

Since morse codes are precise, there is not much room for variations
like with the allophones which are "decoded" by our flexible hearing, so
the gain of meaningful messages will be much less here. But nevertheless
I think it's worth to experiment with it.

Stefan

-- 

> Hi Steve,

> the CW decoder gets mainly the letters E, I and T.
> I also noticed that the beeps are all the same length in your file.

> So I made a raw audio file for EVPmaker that contains three cues: The
> "dit" and "dah" beeps, and an "intra-character gap":

> http://groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/Stefan/Morse%20code/morse.wav

> The "Use Cue List" option must be checked in EVPmaker to use this file.

> Now it sounds a bit more like actual morse code, and CwGet is able to
> decode more letters. Perhaps some former ham operators "over there" are
> able to use it... :)

> Stefan
